features: The push mower features realistic sounds and bubble maker. Help around the yard work with your own toy bubble mower which encourages pretend garden play, bring tons of bubbles and fun.
The handle is very flexible and can be easily disassembled for convenient storage. Bright color mower body is attractive for your toddler.

Automatic bubble blower garden mower tool, fun pushing toys for baby to use is a bubble lawn mower designed for outdoor play in lawns, gardens and yards. It inspires your kids to enjoy outdoor activities.
Bubble machine is perfect for indoor or outdoor party games, Ideal for wonderful birthday gifts and Christmas party gifts for your toddler boys girls age 1 2 3 year old and 18 months.
Includes 1 bubble mower, 3 bubble solutions, 3 bubble sticks. 3 AA batteries required(Not included). Bonus cartoon stickers for kids to personalize and decorate their own bubble machine.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Lydaz Bubbles Toy -- Bubble Lawn Mower Bubble Blower Toy-Outdoor Bubble Machine Toy, helping mom or dad Pretend “mow” the lawn is so much fun. Enjoy Bubbles & Gardening Work Fun

Good Ideal Toys for Toddler & Kids Bubble Lawn Mower Toy The bubble lawn mower is suitable for any holiday gifts, such as Christmas gifts, Easter basket stuffer gifts, Halloween gifts, back to school gifts & summer holiday gifts.Features realistic engine and gear sounds. Electronic bubble machine,fan activated, bubbles flies. Easy to assemble and disassemble. Durable flexible abs, last for long time use.

Let's have some fun! -- Share outdoor bubble fun with friends. Bubbles are a hit with every toddler, crafting a picturesque world with lush green grass and a vibrant blue sky. They add magic to gatherings like parties, birthdays, and outdoor events in gardens, parks, on grassy lawns, and even along sidewalks.
Family Bubble Games Fun Outdoor Toy Share the outdoor bubble world with family and friends Perfect for outdoor games on lawns, gardens and backyard

Pretend Role Play Mowing with Dad Bubble mower encourages pretend to play for Kids This adorable toy lawn mower is a fun way to get kids moving. With its lifelike design, complete with authentic shapes and engine sounds, it closely resembles Mom and Dad's lawnmower. Who said yard work had to be boring? Joining Dad to mow the lawn becomes an incredibly enjoyable experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Child loves it
reviews.reviewText: I just wish there was a way to keep bubbles from spilling. Also, not strong. The child loves it though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars VERY fun gift!
reviews.reviewText: Got this for our grandson who is 16 months. A little young, but he laughed so hard he was shaking! It is easy to put together, works well, and to see him laugh so loud was worth it! The only negative I would say is the reservoir where you put the bubbles is open, so when Will tipped it over, the bubble mix spilled! I know he's just learned to walk, so is tippy himself, but the stuff spills easy! Outdoor toy??? LOL

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Need a gift for a kid whose parents you hate? BUY THIS!
reviews.reviewText: My son (he is 1 now) LOVES to push the button for the bubble motor and then WALKS AWAY. I go turn it off since he's across the room playing with something else and he turns to give me the stink eye, then proceeds to toddle back over and turn the button back on for background noise, then goes and finds something else to do (insert facepalm emoji here). The motor on this thing is decently loud and VERY annoying when you're inside and trapped in the same room as this glorified noisemaker, but the kid loves it so it's here to stay. I think we actually put bubbles in it once- like others have mentioned, the bubble reservoir is completely open on top and my son loves to flip things over with wheels so he can spin them. That and our hardwood floors make actually putting bubbles in the mower (inside the house) a really bad idea. I bought this for my son after he started walking, thinking this was sort of a "help-me-walk" kind of thing. Well it's not. And it doesn't say it is anywhere on here, so that's my own fault.If you have it out for someone that has a little kid and there is some random holiday coming up, BUY THEM THIS! Just include 3 AA batteries for them so they don't get off easy without the torture of the sound this thing makes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great toy. Works great.
reviews.reviewText: Just a piece of my childhood. Didn’t realize it has a motorized bubble blower. Only reason for 4 stars is the bubble juice spills out very easily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Easy to assemble but super cheap and flimsy quality. Worth $10 maybe.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My little nephew loves this
reviews.reviewText: My 2-year old nephew loves playing with this both outside with the bubbles and inside without the bubbles. We wipe dry the bubble solution holder before we bring it inside.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bought as a gift for toddler - He LOVED it!
reviews.reviewText: Definitely a hit! Would recommend! He especially liked the sound and popping the bubbles -- he looked like a mechanic, squatting to check it all out, in between the mowing! LOL

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Poor Design = Poor Toy: Think Dollar Tree / Dollar General Quality
reviews.reviewText: I got this for my almost 2yo bubble loving toodler. I figured it's a lawnmower bubble toy, so it's a nice mix for a kid that likes to follow and do what dad does -- mow the yard. However, there isn't a cover or anything to keep the bubbles in the container. And that makes all the difference. Can you think of a single bubble toy that doesn't have a way to keep the liquid inside? This one. This is key if you're talking about a toy for a 1-3 year old who has no concept of keeping things upright to keep liquid from spilling out of bowl-like containers. The result? My kid managed to dump the bubbles everytime he tried to move the toy from its wayward path. When the toy tilted because the 2 year old got excited, bubbles spilled out. When he tried to walk on the grass with the toy, it got stuck and bubbles spilled. So he picked it up, which caused bubbles to spill. We had used the first bottle within the first 15-30 minutes. And because the bubble compartment needs to be halfway filled for the cycling wands to catch bubbles, it became a shortlived toy. We did better on cement because it was a smoother ride than on the grass, but my kid doesn't walk straight, so every couple of steps we were realigning his path. He loves the toy, but if I'm buying a toy that blows bubbles, I want it to actually be able to keep the bubbles inside and serve its function. I'm really not sure why the manufacturer didn't think of that if toddlers are the target audience. Beautiful concept. Horrible execution, especially given this is cheap, cheap plastic. Cheap as in you could find this toy in the Dollar Tree, but Five Below wouldn't sell this. So 1 star because it's a poorly made product, because my kid actually likes it despite it not doing it's primary function well. In truth, I'd give it a 1/2 star for the kid considering he also likes taking pens and turning them into drum sticks and turning his fingers into microphones... it doesn't take much for him to enjoy himself. There's another lawnmower that lets you attach the bottle to the bottom so all liquid stays. Though I can't return this, I will get that. Anything is better than what we have.
My daughter loves this toy! She occasionally spills out the bubble solution though, but she still loves walking around with it pretending like she’s cutting the grass lol

reviews.reviewTitle: a bit light, little unstable but great bubble machine
reviews.reviewText: it's a bit light especially the long handle which makes it unstable when pushing but still a great bubble machine for my 1 year old. bought a cheap refill from a toy store and all good

The product arrived with one of the bubble solutions spilled all through it, which damaged only the box. But the orange spinning thing was broken as well so I’ve had to keep pushing it back in. Also, my son is a bit unsteady with it so the solution splashes out everywhere and I need to keep refilling. But he enjoys the bubbles and walking with it. I wouldn’t pay more than $20AUD though.
